::Killfest::

"My guess is that he's got the same idea as us. Let the Maximals live,
protect them sometimes even with no cost to him, and bots will take
the battles to their base instead of his." Killfest says, his mind
working hard, "But we should ask him. I'm not saying that I trust him,
but we should at least hear his version of the story."




--- In nbwrpg@y..., logomorph@h... wrote:
> KitKat3::
> 
> She heard the converstaion and felt like she needed to say 
> something. "I wouldn't go into an allience with anyone who sides with 
> the maximals.  How can a pred call themselves a prdacon when they 
> fight alongside a maximal. It's not right. It's against my program to 
> trust a maximal, and I don't know a pred who would. But if want to 
> enter into this, you must be certain that you keep a tight leash on 
> him, or he'll kill you."
> 
> She stopped as her optics flickered a second, then returned to 
> normal. She looked at the group. "Well, it's up to you bots."  She 
> turned and walked out of the room. 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., airly2000@y... wrote:
> > Darkfate::
> > 
> > "Well, an Alliance with Zardus will be great" said the male "But 
> he's 
> > a high risk ally, last events show it... He attacked HellBeast's 
> > troops and he, instead destroy Maximals forces he let them live??? 
> > What will do next? What's his personal agenda?"
> > 
> > Darkfate fell in silence a while "If we have to do an alliance with 
> > the Alliance... we must be awared... We don't know what Zardus 
> wants 
> > with this alliance. If anyone have other thing to say, I like tell 
> > you something else"
> > 
> > Darkfare wait in silence to Killfest's and Drillbit's answer 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., RoboRick007 <rfa007@h...> wrote:
> > > ::DrillBit::
> > > 
> > > He just nods, waiting for DarkFate's input.
